articles.title: New ICE Leadership Appointed Amid Deportation Pressure
articles.description: New ICE Leadership Appointed Amid Deportation Pressure Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem has announced new leadership for the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), signaling a significant shift in the agency's operational strategy. This move comes as ICE faces challenges in aligning with President Donald Trump's aggressive deportation objectives.The Trump administration's deportation figures reveal a noticeable shortfall, with only 37,660 individuals deported during Trump's initial month, compared to the monthly average of 57,000 in the final year of Joe Biden's administration. The recent reassignment of former acting director Caleb Vitello underscores the administration's urgency in bolstering deportation rates.Noem's decision to appoint Todd Lyons as acting director and Madison Sheahan as deputy director marks a definitive effort to increase the agency's effectiveness in fulfilling the American public's expectations regarding illegal immigration. Lyons and Sheahan are tasked with spearheading ICE's initiatives to enhance deportation operations significantly.

articles.description: Turmoil in Kathua: Leadership Challenged as Security Fears Rise The security situation in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district has become a focal point of criticism, with Tariq Hameed Karra accusing the central and lieutenant governor-led administrations of failing to address escalating concerns.During an address to party workers in Samba, Karra highlighted disturbing incidents in the Billawar-Bani belt, underscoring how recent deaths exposed government claims of restored normality.Karra demanded the BJP clarify its stance on the delayed statehood restoration for Jammu and Kashmir, labeling it a crucial issue affecting the region's identity and status.

articles.title: Himachal Pradesh Assembly Urged to Ensure Smooth Budget Session
articles.description: Himachal Pradesh Assembly Urged to Ensure Smooth Budget Session In a move to ensure the seamless functioning of the upcoming budget session, Himachal Pradesh Vidhan Sabha Speaker Kuldeep Singh Pathania on Sunday urged cooperation from both ruling and opposition parties. This call was made following an all-party meeting conducted in a cordial atmosphere.Deliberations centered around the session's agenda and other pertinent issues. The decision regarding conducting the session on Saturday, a day after Holi, remains pending, according to Speaker Pathania. The meeting saw participation from key political figures including Parliamentary Affairs Minister Harshardhan Chauhan and Leader of the Opposition Jai Ram Thakur.Pathania emphasized the importance of the opposition fulfilling its duty by raising questions of public interest, while the government should provide factual answers. Opposition leader Thakur accused the government of failing on multiple fronts, while Minister Chauhan highlighted the assembly as a robust platform for addressing public concerns and pledged government transparency.

articles.title: DRI and Coast Guard Seize Rs 33 Crore Hashish Oil in High-Seas Operation
articles.description: DRI and Coast Guard Seize Rs 33 Crore Hashish Oil in High-Seas Operation DRI and the Indian Coast Guard have collaborated in a high-seas operation resulting in the seizure of 29.95 kg of Hashish Oil, valued at a staggering Rs 33 crore, from a barge headed towards the Maldives.The operation, initiated on March 5, 2025, came after intelligence suggested that a gang in Tuticorin was clandestinely loading large quantities of the narcotic onto the vessel mid-sea, assisted by a crew member.The vessel was intercepted off the Kanyakumari coast and escorted to Tuticorin New Port on March 7. Upon searching, two bags containing 29 plastic packets of Hashish Oil were found. Three individuals have been apprehended, with the contraband seized under the NDPS Act, 1985.

articles.title: Vastu Sleep Hacks: Best directions and bed placements for restful nights
articles.description: If you‚Äôve been struggling with restlessness, disturbed sleep, or waking up tired, simple Vastu adjustments may be the solution. Let‚Äôs dive into the best sleep directions, ideal bed placements, and quick Vastu tips to improve your sleep quality. Best Sleeping Directions as Per Vastu Ideal Sleeping Directions 1. South (Best for Deep Sleep & Overall Well-Being) - According to Vastu, sleeping with your head towards the south and feet pointing north is the best option. - This position aligns with Earth‚Äôs magnetic field, promoting deep sleep, relaxation, and overall well-being. 2. East (Great for Mental Clarity & Spiritual Growth) - If you‚Äôre a student, professional, or someone who needs mental alertness, east-facing sleep can help. - It enhances concentration, memory, and creativity. Avoid These Sleeping Directions 1. North (Causes Restlessness & Health Issues) - Sleeping with your head towards the north is considered inauspicious. - It is believed to disrupt energy balance, leading to disturbed sleep, stress, and even health issues like headaches and anxiety. 2. West (Can Lead to Stress & Delays in Success) - While not as harmful as the north, west-facing sleep is believed to cause unnecessary struggles and delays in personal and professional success. - It may also lead to a restless mind, making it harder to wake up feeling refreshed. Vastu Tips for the Perfect Bed Placement 1. Place the Bed in the Southwest or South - The bed should ideally be positioned in the southwest or south corner of the bedroom for stability and relaxation. - Avoid placing it in the center of the room, as it disrupts energy flow. 2. Avoid Sleeping Under a Beam - If your bed is placed directly under a ceiling beam, it can create pressure and stress, leading to disturbed sleep. - If shifting the bed isn‚Äôt an option, consider false ceiling panels or wooden deÃÅcor to neutralize the effect. 3. Keep the Bed Away from the Bedroom Door - Your bed should not be directly aligned with the bedroom door, as it can lead to disrupted energy flow and restlessness. - The best position is diagonally opposite to the entrance. 4. Use a Solid Headboard for Support - A strong wooden headboard provides a sense of security and stability, promoting peaceful sleep. - Avoid metal headboards, as they may create unnecessary distractions and energy disturbances. 5. No Mirrors Facing the Bed - Mirrors reflecting your bed can cause insomnia and increase mental stress. - If you have a mirror or dressing table opposite your bed, cover it at night to prevent negative effects. 6. Declutter Your Bedroom - Cluttered spaces lead to a cluttered mind. Keep your bedroom organized and free from unnecessary items. - Avoid storing things under your bed, as stagnant energy can impact your sleep quality. 7. Soothing Colors & Soft Lighting - Light pastel shades like blue, lavender, or white promote relaxation and peace. - Avoid dark or overly bright colors, which can create agitation. Bonus: Quick Vastu Fixes for Better Sleep - Use Himalayan salt lamps or essential oils like lavender to create a calming atmosphere. - Avoid placing electronics near your bed, as they emit radiation and disturb sleep cycles. - Keep a bowl of water with sea salt in the bedroom to absorb negative energy. - Sleep on a wooden bed instead of metal for better energy flow. Applying Vastu principles to your sleeping space doesn‚Äôt require a major transformation small tweaks can make a big difference in improving sleep quality. By aligning your bed placement and sleeping direction with positive energy flow, you can enjoy deeper rest, wake up feeling refreshed, and experience better health and well-being.

articles.title: Javed Akhtar makes a bold prediction about Aamir Khan‚Äôs upcoming film; says, ‚ÄúAamir‚Äôs film will connect with everyone and be a super hit‚Äù
articles.description: To celebrate Aamir Khan's 60th birthday on March 14, PVR INOX announced Aamir Khan: Cinema Ka Jadugar, a special film festival honouring his impact on Indian cinema. The festival's trailer launch featured lyricist and screenwriter Javed Akhtar.At a press conference, veteran screenwriter Javed Akhtar made a bold prediction about Aamir‚Äôs next film. ‚ÄúI know I‚Äôm pouring my neck on line. But I‚Äôve put my neck on line before and have been proven right. I was the one who said Aamir will be superstar, Amitabh after series of flop I predicted that he will become a superstar. Today I‚Äôm predicting that the film which will connect with everyone is being made by Aamir. That film will be a super hit.‚ÄùAkhtar emphasized Aamir‚Äôs unique ability to succeed across genres, unlike past Bollywood legends who stuck to one style. He credited Aamir‚Äôs mentor, Nasir Hussain, as an underrated force who shaped stars like Dev Anand and Shammi Kapoor.Akhtar revealed he initially advised Aamir against the project. ‚ÄúAamir‚Äôs magic is that he put his money on unconventional films. I asked him not to do Lagaan. Tried convincing him a lot. I made a list on what all was wrong. He made a list and made a script with all those things. Then I gave up, Ki film to Aamir ko chalani hai. But when I saw the first cut I was blown away.‚ÄùAkhtar praised Aamir for backing films like Taare Zameen Par and Dangal, roles that few actors would dare to take. ‚ÄúPeople don‚Äôt make Taare Zameen Par. People don‚Äôt work in. dangal. He was the actor in RDB who was sitting in a corner and letting other actor take center stage. Only Aamir could have believed in these character and stories.‚ÄùHe added, ‚ÄúAamir did a film with Ashutosh with whose he had a flop before. Who would have done Dangal in their right mind. Role of such an old man who loses to his daughter in kushti. All actors work in films of directors who have given hits. You take chances no other can,‚Äù he added.He also shared a personal connection, revealing that Aamir‚Äôs first film was written by him and that his son, Farhan Akhtar, directed his debut (Dil Chahta Hai) with Aamir as the lead. ‚ÄúAamir was waiting for my call after initially rejecting Farhan‚Äôs script. When I didn‚Äôt call, he realized that Farhan truly believed in him.‚ÄùWith Javed Akhtar‚Äôs ringing endorsement and a legacy of bold choices, all eyes are now on Aamir Khan‚Äôs next film.Also Read : Javed Akhtar on why he called off his legal battle with Kangana Ranaut; says, ‚ÄúShe has given a letter of regret and apologies‚Äù

articles.title: Sholay‚Äôs 50th anniversary celebration at Raj Mandir Jaipur: Sooraj Barjatya shares heartening anecdote about Salman Khan-starrer Maine Pyar Kiya: ‚ÄúRaj Mandir projectionist told me, ‚ÄòAapka hero hit hai, aapka kabootar hit hai‚Äô!‚Äù
articles.description: IIFA Awards completes 25 years and its celebrations are going on in full swing at Jaipur, Rajasthan. Coincidentally, Sholay (1975) completes 50 years this year. Meanwhile, Jaipur‚Äôs iconic single screen cinema hall, Raj Mandir, will step into its 50th year soon. Hence, all these three entities joined hands. The screening of Sholay was held on Sunday, March 9, at Raj Mandir by IIFA and it turned out to be a memorable affair. The screening was attended by Sholay‚Äôs director Ramesh Sippy, fellow reputed filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya and the who‚Äôs who of Jaipur.After a wonderful speech by Rajasthan Deputy Chief Minister Princess Diya Kumari, Sooraj Barjatya and Ramesh Sippy came on stage to speak about their love for films and how they managed to make such historic blockbusters.Sooraj Barjatya said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a very emotional moment for all of us at Rajshri. My uncle and my tauji wanted to be here but couldn‚Äôt because of their health. Our association with Raj Mandir dates back to 1977.‚ÄùHe then shared an interesting anecdote regarding his debut directorial, ‚ÄúI remember Maine Pyar Kiya (1987) was screened here and I had paid a visit. I was very nervous. But the projectionist of Raj Mandir told me, ‚ÄòAapka hero hit hai, aapka kabootar hit hai‚Äô! I went back and told Salman Khan bhai about it that ‚ÄòKhabar aayi hai ki aap hit hai‚Äô!‚ÄùOn this special occasion, the management of Raj Mandir changed their seats. The new seats are far more comfortable and it sets a new benchmark for other single screen theatres that they need to upgrade their facilities, especially when the competition from multiplexes is so immense.Outside the theatre, the organizers had installed a scooter with sidecar, which has now become synonymous with Sholay. The background was pink coloured and it went well with the ‚ÄòPink City‚Äô reference of Jaipur.Also Read: Sholay‚Äôs 50th anniversary celebration at Raj Mandir Jaipur: Rajasthan Deputy Chief Minister Princess Diya Kumari hails Ramesh Sippy, Sooraj Barjatya: ‚ÄúNO Hollywood film can match Sholay or Hum Aapke Hain Koun‚Äù

articles.title: Constable Detained for Alleged Rape Under Pretext of Duty
articles.description: Constable Detained for Alleged Rape Under Pretext of Duty A constable stationed at the Sanganer police department has been taken into custody under allegations of raping a married woman. The incident reportedly occurred when the officer was supposed to be recording a statement from the woman, as per a senior police official.The woman's husband lodged a formal complaint, revealing that the constable, identified as Bhagaram, escorted his wife and young child to a hotel room under false pretenses, claiming he needed her deposition related to an earlier complaint.The assistant commissioner stated that the accused constable used intimidation tactics, threatening repercussions against the woman's husband to ensure her silence. Furthermore, a medical examination is underway to substantiate the allegations of rape.

articles.title: Israeli Woman Tourist Gang-R*ped in Karnataka's Hampi, Three Friends Thrown Into Canal, One Dead
creator: ABP Live
articles.description: A year after the shocking gang rape of a Spanish woman tourist in Chhattisgarh, another similar incident has surfaced. This time, the crime took place in Karnataka‚Äôs Koppal district. Reports indicate that two women were sexually assaulted, one of whom is an Israeli tourist visiting India. She was accompanied by three male friends, who were brutally beaten by the attackers and thrown into a canal. On the morning of March 8, authorities recovered the body of one of the victims. As of now, the police have not yet identified the perpetrators. This tragic incident has once again raised concerns about tourist safety in India.

articles.title: Nashik's Real Estate Surge: Demand Soars Amid Declining Supply
articles.description: Nashik's Real Estate Surge: Demand Soars Amid Declining Supply The Nashik housing market witnessed a noticeable boom last year, with apartment sales climbing 22% to 8,583 units, according to a report by Credai and Liases Foras. This data reflects a rising demand despite a significant decline in new supply.Released during a conference in early March, the report indicates that new apartment supply dropped 30% to 4,325 units. Consequently, unsold inventory decreased 15% to 12,494 units. Price stability was maintained, with per square foot rates between Rs 3,134 and Rs 15,833.Pankaj Kapoor from Liases Foras highlighted the potential for further real estate development in Nashik. Gaurav Thakker of CREDAI's Nashik Chapter attributes the city's growth to enhanced infrastructure and industrial expansion, making it appealing to investors and homebuyers alike.

articles.title: Playbook Partners to Bolster Indian Tech Growth with USD 20 Million Investments
articles.description: Playbook Partners to Bolster Indian Tech Growth with USD 20 Million Investments Playbook Partners, a growth capital firm, is set to invest USD 20 million each in approximately 12-15 companies over the next two years, according to a senior official. With a focus on high-potential ventures, the firm is targeting sectors such as SaaS, E-commerce, Healthtech, and ClimateTech.The firm, which has already invested in companies like Myntra, PolicyBazaar, and InMobi, also supports global giants like SpaceX and Stripe. Founder Vikas Choudhury emphasized that Playbook Partners is looking to assist companies that have surpassed Rs 100 crore turnover, using their capital to expedite further growth.Choudhury outlined the firm's approach to favor growth capital over traditional venture capital, emphasizing market leaders' cash-based outcomes within 3-5 years. Choudhury, a former Jio president, spoke about India's digital explosion and the vast opportunities for new-age businesses in the market.

articles.title: Thackeray Demands Mumbai Parity with Gujarat's GIFT City
articles.description: Thackeray Demands Mumbai Parity with Gujarat's GIFT City Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray has accused the BJP of deliberately undermining Mumbai's economic position by shifting major projects to Gujarat and Delhi. Speaking at a party event, he demanded subsidies and facilities for Mumbai akin to those provided to Gujarat's GIFT City.Thackeray criticized the BJP's strategies, which he argues have led to the relocation of corporate headquarters away from Mumbai, questioning the long-term impact on Maharashtra's economy. He emphasized that Mumbai, as the backbone of India's economy, should not lose its prominence.He also raised concerns about the involvement of private entities, like the Adani Group, in projects near the Navi Mumbai airport and criticized delays in Mumbai's infrastructure development. Thackeray expressed disappointment over the decline in healthcare services in the city's civic hospitals and vowed to oppose any detrimental policies.

articles.title: Court Denies Bail in High-Profile Sexual Harassment Case
articles.description: Court Denies Bail in High-Profile Sexual Harassment Case A Thane court has denied the bail application of an educational institute chairman accused of rape and sexual harassment. The judge cited the ongoing investigation and substantial evidence against Rameshchandra Shobnath Mishra as reasons for the decision.Mishra, arrested on January 30, is accused of demanding payments and coercing a woman into a sexual relationship under the guise of offering employment. The victim claims she paid Rs 6 lakh but faced further exploitation when she refused to comply further.The defense pointed to the victim's lack of qualifications and Mishra's health issues, arguing for bail. However, the prosecution highlighted similar accusations by other women and the necessity for continued investigation. The court ruled against bail, referencing multiple Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita charges.

articles.title: Indore BSc student dies by suicide after jumping from college building; Police begin probe
articles.description: Indore (Madhya Pradesh) [India], March 9 (ANI): A third-year college student allegedly died by suicide after jumping from the third floor of his college in Dwarkapuri, Indore, police said on Sunday. The incident took place on Saturday, and from his social media status, police say they suspect that his mental state was not sound. Anand Yadav, Additional DCP Zone 4, said, "This is an incident of the Dwarkapuri police station area where a boy named Mayur Rajput, who was a BSc third-year student, jumped from the third floor of the college and committed suicide from there. Right now, we are investigating the reason. So far, it has been found that he had posted something on his social media status in which he had written that neither could I become a good student nor a good son. He has done something like this in his mental state." The police are currently investigating the case. "We are investigating the rest. In the investigation, all these things will be discussed with the family members, and once all the talks are done, everything will be clear. He is a third-year student, so his age will be between 19 and 20 years," he further said. (ANI)

articles.title: Eighth Day Of Ramadan ‚Äì Check The Iftar Timings For Delhi, Mumbai, Lucknow, And Other Cities
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: Ramadan, the ninth month of the Islamic calendar, is considered a sacred period in which Allah bestows His blessings, mercy, and opportunities for worship upon His followers. During this holy month, Muslims across the world observe fasting, known as Sawm in Arabic. The fast continues throughout the entire month, and as of March 9, 2025, one week of fasting will be completed, with the eighth fast being observed on Sunday.ALSO READ: Ramadan 2025: Maintaining Hydration During The Fasting ‚Äî Expert RecommendationsFasting In Ramadan: A Spiritual DevotionFasting in Ramadan is not merely about abstaining from food and drink. It is a time when Muslims exercise self-control, engage in worship, seek forgiveness, and strive for spiritual growth. Observing the fast is an essential practice in Islam, as it is one of the five pillars of the faith. Ramadan offers believers a golden opportunity to connect with Allah through fasting, prayers, Taraweeh, charity (Zakat and Sadaqah), and other acts of devotion.Significance Of Sehri And Iftar During RamadanOne of the most crucial aspects of fasting is observing Sehri and Iftar. Sehri refers to the pre-dawn meal consumed before beginning the fast, while Iftar marks the breaking of the fast at sunset. Without these two essential practices, the process of fasting is considered incomplete. Hence, it is important for all fasting individuals to ensure that they eat at the right times.As Sehri and Iftar timings vary across different cities by a few minutes, here are the iftar timings for Sunday, March 9, 2025, in major Indian cities:Ramadan 2025: Iftar Timings For March 9 In India:Delhi: 06:29 PMMumbai: 06:47 PMHyderabad: 06:33 PMKanpur: 06:16 PMLucknow: 06:14 PMKolkata: 05:44 PMMeerut: 06:27 PMNoida: 06:28 PMBengaluru: 06:34 PMAhmedabad: 06:48 PMPatna: 05:57 PMRanchi: 05:59 PMChennai: 06:20 PM[Disclaimer: The content of this article is based solely on beliefs, and should be taken as general guidance. Individual experiences may vary. ABPLive.com does not assert the accuracy or validity of any claims or information presented. It is strongly recommended to consult a qualified expert before considering or implementing any information or belief discussed herein.]

articles.title: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar Hospitalized at AIIMS
articles.description: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar Hospitalized at AIIMS In the early hours of Sunday, India's Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar experienced uneasiness and chest pain, leading to his admission at AIIMS in New Delhi. The 73-year-old was taken to the hospital around 2 am.Sources reveal that Dhankhar is being treated in the Critical Care Unit under the supervision of Dr. Rajiv Narang, Head of the Department of Cardiology at AIIMS. His condition is currently stable.A dedicated team of doctors is carefully monitoring the Vice President's health, ensuring he receives the necessary medical attention during this time.

articles.title: Labor Party's Resounding Victory in Western Australia
articles.description: Labor Party's Resounding Victory in Western Australia Australia's Labor Party celebrated a decisive re-election victory in Western Australia on Saturday, solidifying its position ahead of the anticipated national election due by mid-May. The win reinforces the party's dominance, further bolstering the standing of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, despite notable challenges posed by high living costs.Western Australia's Premier Roger Cook expressed gratitude, emphasizing his commitment to serving the state. As results poured in, the Labor Party secured 40 seats while the Liberal opposition lingered with just four, according to the Australian Broadcasting Corp's latest figures.Prime Minister Albanese hailed the result as an 'extraordinary' achievement, attributing part of the success to the government's effective pandemic response and appealing family policies. The victory underscores Labor's robust hold in Western Australia, having won a historic number of seats in both state and federal elections since March 2021.

articles.description: The ongoing conflict in Ukraine has sparked global reactions, with key international players unable to broker a peace agreement. Various solutions, such as a demilitarized zone or a security consortium involving neighboring countries, are being considered to find a path to peace and stability.

articles.title: Trump's Executive Orders Against Law Firms Stir Constitutional Debate
articles.description: Trump's Executive Orders Against Law Firms Stir Constitutional Debate President Donald Trump's executive orders targeting the law firms Perkins Coie and Covington & Burling have sparked intense debate among legal experts over potential constitutional violations. These measures, viewed by some as acts of retribution, may infringe on First Amendment speech protections and Fifth Amendment due process rights, an unsettling precedent according to critics.Trump's directives limit access to federal buildings for Perkins Coie attorneys, questioning their security clearances. The orders challenge their government contracts, touching on serious allegations of racial discrimination. Meanwhile, Covington faces sanctions over its association with Special Counsel Jack Smith, who initiated criminal proceedings against Trump.Trump's actions have faced significant backlash from the legal community, raising concerns about viewpoint discrimination and government interference. As legal scholars prepare for potential challenges, the struggle underscores the volatile intersection of politics and law in this unprecedented standoff.

articles.title: BMW Incident Sparks Traffic Junction Scandal in Pune
articles.description: BMW Incident Sparks Traffic Junction Scandal in Pune A viral video capturing a man stepping out of a BMW and urinating at a traffic junction in Pune has led to the detention of two individuals. The incident, which occurred in the Shastrinagar area of Yerawada, was recorded by an eyewitness.Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and Motor Vehicles Act have been invoked against Gaurav Ahuja, the BMW driver, and his co-passenger Bhagyesh Oswal for creating a public nuisance and engaging in rash and negligent driving. Law enforcement officials arrested Ahuja in Satara after he initially fled.In the viral clip, Oswal is seen in the luxury car's front seat while Ahuja engages in the offensive act before driving away and making an obscene gesture. Afterward, Ahuja posted a social media video apologizing and vowing to surrender within hours.

articles.title: 20 Killed In Russian Strike On Ukraine After US Stops Sharing Intelligence With Kyiv
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: At least 20 people were killed in Russian strikes on Ukraine, said the officials on Saturday after a decision by the US to stop sharing satellite images with Kyiv. The decision to withhold intelligence and military aid came on the heels of the dramatic spat between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US President Donald Trump. In the absence of satellite imagery by the US, Ukraine's ability to strike inside Russia and defend itself from bombardment is significantly reduced.ALSO READ | 'Russia-Ukraine War Could End Up In World War III': Donald TrumpOver 20 Killed In Multiple Strikes Multiple strikes by Russia on a town in Ukraine's embattled Donetsk region killed at least 11 people while 40 more were injured, said regional Gov. Vadym Filashkin, reported Associated Press. Eight apartment blocks in the town of Dobropillya, lost to the front where Russian troops have been making steady advances, were also damaged in the strikes. A drone also damaged a Ukrainian fire truck while rescuers fought to extinguish the burning buildings, said Ukraine's State Emergency Service. In the front-line towns of Pokrovsk, Kostyantynivka, Myrnograd and Ivanopillya, six other people were killed in the Russian strikes, Filashkin said. Emergency service reported that three other people died when a Russian drone hit a civilian workshop in the northeastern Kharkiv region. The regional Governor declared Saturday a day of mourning and warned that more victims could still be found in the rubble.ALSO READ | British Columbia SC Sentences Second Hitman To Life For Murder Of Ex-Air India Bombing SuspectVile, Inhumane Intimidation Tactic: Zelenskyy Ukrainian President Zelenskyy said that the destruction in Dobropillya was caused by a ballistic missile strike. ‚ÄúLast night, the Russian army fired two ballistic missiles at the centre of Dobropillya,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAfter emergency services arrived at the scene, they launched another strike, deliberately targeting rescuers. It is a vile and inhumane intimidation tactic to which the Russians often resort.‚Äù Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk slammed the strikes by Russia as the result of ‚Äúwhat happens when someone appeases barbarians".‚ÄúMore bombs, more aggression, more victims. Another tragic night in Ukraine," Tusk said in a social media post.

articles.title: Simultaneous polls will undermine country's federal structure: NPF
articles.description: The Naga Peoples' Front (NPF) on Saturday strongly opposed the proposal of simultaneous polls to the Lok Sabha and state assemblies, asserting that it would undermine India's federal structure and lead to a "one-party rule".Raising the issue of 'One Nation, One Election' (ONOE) during the Zero Hour of the Nagaland assembly, NPF MLA Achumbemo Kikon said it is detrimental to India, which is known for its unity in diversity.He claimed ONOE would undermine India's federal structure and the autonomy of individual states, especially Nagaland, which was born out of a political agreement, with special privileges inserted under Article 371(A) of the Constitution.He argued that synchronising elections would diminish the role of regional parties, which play a crucial part in advocating for local issues.Kikon said ONOE could overshadow regional issues with national political narratives, especially from financially dominant national parties.This shift, he said, would jeopardise the democr

articles.title: Zelenskiy's Diplomatic Push: Ukraine Seeks Constructive Dialogue in Saudi Arabia
articles.description: Zelenskiy's Diplomatic Push: Ukraine Seeks Constructive Dialogue in Saudi Arabia Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has affirmed the nation's commitment to constructive dialogue with United States delegates in Saudi Arabia next week, with hopes of reaching crucial agreements. The president emphasized that Ukraine has been advocating for peace since the inception of the conflict.In a statement on social media platform X, Zelenskiy highlighted the importance of swift and effective actions based on realistic proposals already on the table. His visit to Saudi Arabia aims to solidify these dialogues and create pathways toward conflict resolution.Zelenskiy will meet with the Saudi Crown Prince on Monday, followed by meetings between Ukrainian diplomats and military officials with the U.S. team the next day, signaling a strategic effort to manage the geopolitical situation efficiently.

articles.title: Rajasthan: The Cinematic Jewel of India
articles.description: Rajasthan: The Cinematic Jewel of India Rajasthan, a linchpin of Indian cinema, is indispensable to the Bollywood landscape, according to Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma. Speaking at a pre-event for the 25th International Indian Film Academy (IIFA) Awards in Jaipur, Sharma highlighted the 61 film projects shot in the state over the past year.The event, marking a silver jubilee, underscores not only the prestige of the IIFA Awards but also Rajasthan's growing global stature in Indian cinema. Sharma extolled Rajasthan as an unparalleled film production venue, promising promising tourism opportunities from the event.Emphasizing Rajasthan's exceptional infrastructure, Sharma noted the strength of the region's road and rail networks. He accredited Rajasthan's appeal to its majestic palaces and fortresses, which have become magnets for both film and wedding tourism, highlighted by visits from national and international celebrities.

articles.title: ‚ÄòRahul Gandhi Now Blaming His Own, Sign Of His Deteriorating Mental State‚Äô: BJP On Gujarat Remarks
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has hit out at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his recent remarks about internal divisions within his party, accusing him of shifting blame onto his own colleagues. During a press conference on Saturday, BJP spokesperson and MP Sudhanshu Trivedi criticised Rahul, saying, ‚ÄúRahul Gandhi says he is chained...From alleging his party, people, constitutional institutions, and media‚Äîhe has now started blaming his own people. I suggest he do self-introspection instead of blaming others.‚ÄùHe also remarked, ‚ÄúThis is a reflection of his deteriorating mental state and Congress party's deterioration.‚Äù Union Minister Giriraj Singh also attacked the Congress leader, stating, ‚ÄúGujarat Congress leaders and workers have proven that they do not trust Rahul Gandhi, and today, Rahul Gandhi himself has admitted it. When questions are raised on the leadership, then the supporters and cadres leave the party‚Äù, news agency ANI reported.ALSO READ | Rahul Gandhi Says Congress Insiders Are Working For BJP In Gujarat, Hints At Mass Expulsion Rahul Gandhi's Stresses Need To 'Filter Out' Congress Leaders 'Working For BJP'Rahul Gandhi, who is on a two-day visit to Gujarat, stressed on Friday that there was a need to ‚Äúfilter out‚Äù Congress workers and leaders who were working for the BJP, news agency PTI reported.Addressing party workers in Ahmedabad on Saturday, he reiterated, ‚ÄúThe leadership of Gujarat, the workers of Gujarat, the district presidents (Congress) of Gujarat, the block presidents‚Äîthere are two types of people. One, stands with the people, fights for them, respects them, and has the ideology of the Congress in his heart. The other is the one who is cut off from the people, sits far away, does not respect the people, and half of them have joined the BJP. Until we clearly separate these two, the people of Gujarat cannot believe in us.‚Äù #WATCH | Ahmedabad: Lok Sabha LoP and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi says "The leadership of Gujarat, the workers of Gujarat, the district presidents (Congress) of Gujarat, the block presidents, there are two types of people in them, there are divisions. One, stands with the people,‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/B7peYXCjRa‚Äî ANI (@ANI) March 8, 2025His visit to Gujarat is part of a larger strategy for the 2027 assembly elections. Upon his arrival in Ahmedabad, Rahul met senior party leaders, including former state Congress presidents and opposition leaders. He later attended a meeting with the state political affairs committee and held discussions with district and city Congress presidents, as well as nearly 400 taluka and municipality chiefs. All India Congress Committee (AICC) general secretary K C Venugopal said Rahul was focused on strengthening the party. ‚ÄúRahul Gandhi gave his entire time to listen to party leaders from the block, district, and state levels. Our concentration is to strengthen the organisation, and that is why we are taking views of local leaders,‚Äù he said, as per PTI. During the meetings, Rahul urged the state Congress unit to raise local issues, including unemployment, inflation, women‚Äôs security, and farmers‚Äô distress. He assured party cadres of a major overhaul, promising accountability among office-bearers. Special emphasis was laid on strengthening the party‚Äôs booth-level structure. The upcoming AICC session, scheduled for April 8-9 in Ahmedabad, will be the first such gathering in the state in 64 years. In the 2022 Gujarat assembly elections, the Congress won only 17 out of 182 seats, and its strength in the House later dropped to 12 following the resignation of five MLAs.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Politics: A Battle Over Language Policy
articles.description: Tamil Nadu Politics: A Battle Over Language Policy The debate over language policy in Tamil Nadu has intensified, with Congress leader P Chidambaram criticizing the lack of implementation of the three-language formula in Hindi-dominant states. He argues that these states, where Hindi pervades education and is often the only language taught, undermine the policy by not incorporating regional languages.P Chidambaram highlighted that Tamil Nadu‚Äôs 52 Kendriya Vidyalayas, run by the Central Government, fail to include Tamil in their curriculum. Instead, they offer English as a medium of instruction and teach either Hindi or Sanskrit. Meanwhile, in Tamil Nadu, the long-standing two-language policy emphasizes Tamil and English, although private and CBSE schools offer Hindi voluntarily.Chief Minister Stalin vehemently opposed the Union Government's language imposition, accusing the Education Minister of instigating a confrontation. Stalin argued that Tamil Nadu, which surpasses the New Education Policy‚Äôs objectives for 2030, will not succumb to threats of Hindi colonialism, labeling the BJP's campaign for the three-language policy as a political misstep.

articles.title: Tragic Collision on Maharashtra Highway Injures Local Preacher
articles.description: Tragic Collision on Maharashtra Highway Injures Local Preacher A serious road accident in Maharashtra‚Äôs Latur district left a car driver gravely injured after colliding with a container on the national highway near Pimpri village in Udgir tehsil on Saturday. Police reported that the container and car collided head-on, leading to severe injuries for the car driver, Sangmeshwar Valandikar.Witnesses noted that Valandikar, identified as a preacher, was on his way to deliver a sermon in Telangana when the unfortunate incident occurred. Following the collision, the driver of the container reportedly fled the scene, leaving Valandikar to be rushed to a local hospital.Sources suggest that a truck broken down on the road might have been the underlying cause of the accident. Authorities continue to investigate the circumstances surrounding the collision, urging the runaway driver to surrender.

articles.title: IND vs NZ, Champions Trophy 2025 final: Ravi Shastri names Kiwi players who could trouble India
articles.description: Former India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri outlined the biggest threat posed by New Zealand to India in the upcoming high-stakes Champions Trophy final in Dubai on Sunday, ICC review reported. India will finally have an opportunity to avenge its past heartbreaks inflicted at the hands of New Zealand in the 2000 Champions Trophy and the final of the inaugural World Test Championship. IND vs NZ: Rachin Ravindra tops Shastri's list At the top of the list stood young southpaw Rachin Ravindra, who has thrived in the early days of his career on his sheer consistency. His knack for hunting down the three-digit figures has made him a force to be reckoned with. Also read: Who is NZ star Rachin Ravindra's girlfriend? Meet Premila Morar; know profession, net worth and more In the second semi-final clash against South Africa, Rachin upped the ante and slammed his fifth ODI century, all of them coming in ICC events. According to Shastri, Rachin's talent resonates in his rare talent of playing an invaluable knock in pulsating affairs. "I just like the way he moves in the crease. There's an element of fluency, which is fabulous to see. He's either forward, he's back, he'll cut, he'll sweep it, play the quicks well and he's got a very good temperament. You don't get hundreds in big tournaments like this just like that. You've got to have something up your sleeve and I think he's immensely talented," Shastri said on the latest episode of The ICC Review. IND vs NZ: Shastri names Kane Williamson as threat The next player on Shastri's list is New Zealand's modern-day stalwart Kane Williamson. The veteran batter found his groove in the semi-final and kept his strike rate high with his elegant strokeplay. He played a starring role for the Blackcaps and impressed in the group stage against India (81) and South Africa (102), becoming an imperative for New Zealand's fortunes on Sunday. "He's very stable and there's an element of calmness, a no-nonsense element about him the way he goes about his job. He's like a saint, a sage, just sitting, meditating. A lot of people look at the big shots, I look at the way he moves in the crease. There's an element of fluency," he said. "Joe Root when he's batting at his best. He's forward, back. Kohli (as well). When people move in the crease, the footwork is sound. It's a joy to watch. And then with their experience, their talent, the volume of runs they've got, doesn't matter what format they play," he added. IND vs NZ: Shastri picks Santner among bowlers With the ball Shastri expects New Zealand captain Mitchell Santner to wreak havoc by weaving spin traps. In his debut tournament as a skipper, Santner has made his presence felt across all spectrums of the game. Also read: IND vs NZ, Champions Trophy 2025 final: Shubman Gill looks to turn 2023 WC heartbreak into CT glory He has been a prime wicket-taking candidate for the Kiwis, chipped in with cameos with the bat and regulated his bowling options to their optimum effect. 'He's an intelligent man. And I think this captaincy suits him. It just adds that edge to him as a batter, as a bowler, as a cricketer. So I think it's a smart move by New Zealand opting for that and just the way he goes about his job, like I said, he's a good reader of the game, is an intelligent bloke and should be there for some time for New Zealand," he said. Shastri also gave a special mention to Glenn Phillips and said, "He might just show flashes of brilliance in the field. He might come and smash a cameo of 40-50 and probably surprise you by taking a wicket or two."

articles.title: MP man in 'coma' walks out of hospital with tubes attached, accuses doctors of minting money (WATCH)
articles.description: A chaotic scene unfolded outside a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam when a half-naked man, frail and clutching a colostomy bag around his waist, stood in protest, accusing doctors of demanding Rs 1 lakh for treatment. A nasal tube still attached, he vented his frustration, claiming he was being exploited‚Äîan allegation swiftly denied by the hospital management. A video capturing his distress outside GD Hospital went viral on social media on Monday, prompting the state health department to launch an inquiry into the matter. A hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam witnessed unprecedented scenes when a patient walked out onto the road with a catheter and breathing tube still attached to him and accused the authorities of the institution of carrying out a fraud. pic.twitter.com/oGyhffi25v ‚Äî PUNEET VIZH (@Puneetvizh) March 8, 2025 Officials identified the man as Bunty Ninama, a resident of Moti Nagar. He was initially admitted to the government hospital attached to the Medical College after sustaining injuries in a brawl in Deendayal Nagar on Sunday night. Later, he was transferred to GD Hospital for further treatment. Also read: UP SHOCKER! 6-year-old forced to lick spit, slapped 30 times on school bus, threatened, narrates ordeal| WATCH Eyewitnesses described how Ninama created a ruckus outside the hospital before leaving in an autorickshaw with his wife. His wife, still in shock, told reporters, "We had already spent Rs 40,000 within 12 hours of admission at the hospital. I then left to arrange for more money. However, when I returned, my husband, who doctors said was in coma, was standing outside in an irate condition." Hospital defends itself Chief Medical and Health Officer (CMHO) Dr. MS Sagar confirmed the formation of a three-member committee to investigate the claims. GD Hospital, however, dismissed Ninama‚Äôs allegations as baseless. In a statement, the hospital management clarified that the patient‚Äôs total bill amounted to only Rs 8,000 and denied any demands for additional payment. Also read: UP SHOCKER! Man kills girlfriend, ties head, legs with rope, packs body in trolley bag & dumps it in bushes

articles.title: Trailblazer Anjlee Agarwal Champions Accessibility on PM Modi's Social Media
articles.description: Trailblazer Anjlee Agarwal Champions Accessibility on PM Modi's Social Media Anjlee Agarwal, a prominent advocate for universal accessibility, took the reins of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's social media accounts on Women's Day. Her call to action centered on creating a more inclusive India under the Sugamya Bharat initiative.Agarwal, with over three decades of experience, stressed the importance of breaking barriers to ensure dignified and independent living for all, especially women and those with disabilities. Her career spans research, policy advocacy, and training programs aimed at establishing accessible spaces.In addition, Agarwal's efforts have been pivotal in transforming educational infrastructure across India to prevent education denial due to inaccessibility. She also conducted accessibility audits for various sites and contributed to WASH facility advancements, ultimately shaping policies through extensive collaborations.

In recent years, this region has seen substantial GDP growth, underscoring its economic significance and potential for further development.

articles.title: Tragedy Strikes Dobropillia: Missile Attacks Claim Lives
articles.description: Tragedy Strikes Dobropillia: Missile Attacks Claim Lives Tragedy unfolded in Ukraine's eastern city of Dobropillia as Russian missile and drone attacks resulted in the deaths of at least 11 people, including children, with 30 others wounded. The Ukrainian Interior Ministry provided this grim update on Saturday.The attacks, which occurred overnight, employed ballistic missiles, multiple rockets, and drones, painting a picture of destruction across the city. Both multi-storey buildings and cars sustained significant damage.The Interior Ministry's statement highlighted the intensity and scale of the attacks, which have left a scar on the city's landscape and the people who call it home.
